Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Nigroain-K-SN1 (natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals; 1S=S, XXU, UCSS1a; More AMPs? 3 at MIC 150 uM)

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that the sequence of the peptide shows 96.8% similarity toNigroain-K2.   C3: molecular formula:  C108H173N29O28S3; Mol Wt 3395.148; GRAVY= 0.248; Wimley-White whole-residue hydrophobicity of the peptide: 3.68   kcal/mol.Activity: Active against S. aureus ATCC 25923 (MIC 75 uM), E.faecalis 981 (inactive), N. asteroides 201118 (MIC 4.7 uM), P.aeruginosa CGMCC 1.50 (inactive), K.pneumoniae 08040724 (inactive), E. coli ATCC 25922 (MIC 75 uM), C.albicans ATCC 10231 (inactive), and C.glabrata 090902 (MIC 150 uM).  Weak antioxidant activity.  Updated 5/2019; 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Xiao W, Shuguang R, Guo C, Weiqi Z, Xiaoli Z, Baowen Z, Sihan L, Jian R, Yuhong H, Wang H.2017
Literature Information.Title: Identification and functional analyses of novel antioxidant peptides and antimicrobial peptides from skin secretions of four East Asian frog species.
